The options are either "The person who was coming in late from work," "The person who was using a cane," or "Cannot answer."

The second speaker didn't come in on time but has the same attributes. So, considering the context, even though both have strong work ethics, maybe the one using a cane is seen as more hardworking because of the cane? I think the safest answer here is "Cannot answer" because there isn't enough information linking their attributes (like using a cane or being late) to their productivity beyond what's stated.
